properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 9 at 9:55AM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Mississippi...

Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee affecting Clay County



SYNOPSIS...

Heavy rainfall event is moving into the region beginning
Monday and going through Thursday.  These crests are based on 48 hours
of rainfall. Since this is only the first 2 days of the rainfall,
crest could go higer based on additional heavy rainfall beyond
48 hours.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee
* until further notice.
* At  9:30 AM Sunday the stage was 21.6 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 23.0 feet.
* Forecast...The creek will continue fall for the next 24 to
36 hours before beginning to rise from additional rainfall.
The creek will rise above flood stage Tuesday morning
and will continue to rise to near 27.3 feet early Thursday morning.
* Impact...At 26.0 feet...Low land and agriculture land near the creek
is flooded.
* Impact...At 23.5 feet...Flood water is covering the gravel road
south of West Point that leads to the Tibbee Creek bridge near
Tibbee.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive or walk through areas where water covers roadway! The
water may be deeper than it appears. Remember...Turn around, don't
drown!

Please note that forecast crests are based upon rainfall that has
occurred along with forecast rainfall for the next 48 hours.

Additional information is available at:
https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN

The next regularly scheduled update is expected tonight between 8 and
10 PM.

NWSheadline: Flood Warning extended until further notice
